metadata.title: CVE-2020-6464 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Type confusion in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 81.0.4044.138 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 81.0.4044.138-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 81.0.4044.138-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 81.0.4044.138-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 81.0.4044.138-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 81.0.4044.138-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0.4044.138-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
